title: Happiness Is a Warm Company?
sub_head: Human well-being is neither a skill nor a virtue, and no business-school course can teach it.
body:
“A hot course at Harvard Business School promises to teach future leaders an elusive skill—managing happiness,” according to a recent Journal article. This development was expected. After languishing for decades in philosophy departments, the study of happiness has become a growth industry.
Paying more attention to human well-being is a good thing, and those who try to teach happiness “skills” deserve an A for effort. But does the “happiness studies” approach get its subject entirely right?
